com.aurel.track.admin.customize.scripting

Class GroovyScriptLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.aurel.track.admin.customize.scripting.GroovyScriptLoader

  • public class GroovyScriptLoader
extends java.lang.Object
    This class loads all available scripts from the database and provides them in a GroovyClassLoader. You can use it like this:

      GroovyClassLoader gloader = GroovyScriptLoader.getLoader();
      
      GroovyObject book = GroovyScriptLoader.newInstance("org.sampleproj.Book", gloader);
      book.setProperty("title", "Book's Title");
      book.setProperty("author", "Book's Author Name");
      book.setProperty("year", 2009);

      GroovyObject shelf = newInstance("org.sampleproj.Shelf", gloader);
      shelf.invokeMethod("addBook", book);
      shelf.invokeMethod("printBooks", null);

    The Groovy script for "org.sampleproj.Book" would look like this:

    package org.sampleproj;

    class Book {
      String title;
      String author;
      Integer year;

      Book() {}

      Book(String title, String author, Integer year) {
         this.title = title;
         this.author = author;
         this.year = year;
      }

      void printInfo() {
         println "${title} | ${author} | ${year}";
      }
    }

    The Groovy script for "org.sampleproj.Shelf" would look like this:

    package org.sampleproj;

    class Shelf {
      ArrayList books;

      Shelf() {
         books = [];
      }

      void addBook(Book book) {
         books += book;
      }

      void printBooks() {
         books.each {
              println "${it.title} | ${it.author} | ${it.year}";
         }
      }
    }

    Since:
    3.7.0

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static GroovyScriptLoader getInstance()
        GroovyScriptLoader is a Singleton. This will create the single instance in case it does not yet exist, and will return it.

      • newInstance

        public groovy.lang.GroovyObject newInstance(java.lang.String classname)
                                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns a GroovyObject of the given type, if it can be found.
        Parameters:
        classname - - the fully qualified classname for the object you want to create
        gloader - - GroovyClassLoader to be used, and which has compiled this class

        Returns:
        the desired GroovyObject

        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - in case anything goes wrong

      • doesGroovyClassExist

        public boolean doesGroovyClassExist(java.lang.String gClassName)
        A quick check if a Groovy class exists. This will look up the classname in a hash map. It permits to flexibly work around any missing classes without having to search the database.
        Parameters:
        gClassName - - the fully qualified name of the class.

        Returns:
        true if this class exists
